serrano noun
(PEPPER)

[ C ] (also serrano pepper) a long, thin, green or red pepper (= a vegetable with a hollow centre) that has a very hot taste: Adding a serrano to guacamole gives it a great hot taste. My friends love spicy food, so I am going to add another serrano to the mixture.
More examplesFewer examplesTry adding a chopped serrano to get a more authentic flavour.If you prefer a milder taste, you can leave the serrano pepper out of the recipe.The serrano pepper provides a bit of heat to balance out the sweetness of the onions.
